intro: Pentaschistis expansa, commonly known as the broadleaf star-flower, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, star-shaped white or pink flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
